context: The protein concentration in all samples was determined by the method of Lowryusing bovine serum albumin as standards. Lactose ureide and maltose ureide were synthesized by acid-catalyzed condensation of lactose/maltose and urea according to the method of Hoffmann [11, 12]. Arabinose ureide was synthesized using the method developed by Helfrich and Kosche. Cellobiose ureide was produced by dissolving 15 g of d-cellobiose and 5.26 g urea in 22 ml boiling water. The mixture was cooled to room temperature and then adjusted to pH 3. After heating at 45°C for 12 days the product was crystallized after ethanol addition (1:5 ratio). After cooling to 4°C the solution was seeded with a few cellobiose ureide crystals.
